feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: an AI agent that parses contracts, extracts variables, reconstructs cash flows, computes effective APRs, and outputs verdicts (shown with both a predatory example and a standard loan). Iterative implementation and reflection evidence (Implement and Reflect stages) support that the tool performs substantive financial tasks reliably enough to pass.
- Integrate AI: The submission demonstrates an active, substantive AI integration: a deployed agent that ingests contracts, extracts variables, computes effective APRs, and flags risks (supported by concrete examples and outputs). The student also iteratively improved the system and reflected on prompt engineering and verification, showing effective and meaningful use of AI beyond a superficial mention.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "Instead of a traditional calculator, I made an agent that takes raw legal text. It extracts the hidden variables and reconstructs the cash flow to reveal what is actually happening in digestible terms."
"In the second loop, I added the detailed fee structure and cost of capital breakdown that it will output."
"So, this will also show the calculation log logic as to how it reaches the APR."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: identified the problem of small business owners needing financial/contract analysis.  
Implement: described tools (Google AI Studio, Gemini) and iterative loops adding fee breakdown, payment-frequency detection, and calculation logs.  
Reflect: noted limitations (math oversights) and prompt-engineering fixes to improve reliability.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: an AI agent that parses contracts, extracts variables, reconstructs cash flows, computes effective APRs, and outputs verdicts (shown with both a predatory example and a standard loan). Iterative implementation and reflection evidence (Implement and Reflect stages) support that the tool performs substantive financial tasks reliably enough to pass.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "[My approach is that instead of a traditional calculator, I made an agent that takes raw legal text. It extracts the hidden variables and reconstructs the cash flow to reveal what is actually happening in digestible terms.]"
"[My tools for this were Google AI studio and Gemini.]"
"[So what we'll output is that this is a fail. We shouldn't take this um contract. Nobody should because we see that the true effective APR is 176%.]"
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — identified the problem and proposed an AI agent to parse legal text; Implement — named tools (Google AI Studio, Gemini) and described iterative prompt/refinement loops and added outputs like fee breakdowns, APR calculation logs, and categorization; Reflect — discussed prompt engineering and verification steps taken to mitigate AI errors.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates an active, substantive AI integration: a deployed agent that ingests contracts, extracts variables, computes effective APRs, and flags risks (supported by concrete examples and outputs). The student also iteratively improved the system and reflected on prompt engineering and verification, showing effective and meaningful use of AI beyond a superficial mention.
